Articles.Content: <figure data-orig-width="480" data-orig-height="92" class="tmblr-full"><img src="http://36.media.tumblr.com/ab8ca95fa6c767a94ca66db2600759c6/tumblr_inline_nvlw1bJvSa1rr2wit_540.jpg" data-orig-width="480" data-orig-height="92"/></figure><figure data-orig-width="1080" data-orig-height="608" class="tmblr-full"><img src="http://40.media.tumblr.com/45d7a1e991999ad855ccb78b3f1732b9/tumblr_inline_nvlw1n3O7i1rr2wit_540.jpg" data-orig-width="1080" data-orig-height="608"/></figure><p>The Deep Space Exploration Vessels mod is inspired by numerous NASA studies on deep space exploration. With DSEV, you can create your on deep space exploration vessels, or kerbal versions of: Discovery II and coming soon: Copernicus Bimodal NTR. <br/><a href="http://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/135717">To know more about this mod check the link</a><br/><br/></p>
Ooh! I've seen this before and it looks awesome!
Very, very cool! On a side note, it's no wonder the Copernicus program was canceled -- so many launches with so many points of failure.

Very, very cool! On a side note, it's no wonder the Copernicus program was canceled -- so many launches with so many points of failure.

Constellation was the program that was cancelled, and unrelated to the Copernicus spacecraft, which is a hypothetical design. The Copernicus PROJECT is alive and well, and is a NASA software used for trajectory visualization and optimization.

Lofting the Copernicus spacecraft would have a lot of potential points of failure, but it's also not likely in the near term. More on topic, though, this mod is pretty awesome and I look forward to seeing what designs get added. It'd be lovely to see some of the VASIMR and HOPE designs realized in KSP. Discovery II, Copernicus, and NAUTILUS-X are super cool, though.
You need replica parts from the Hermes (The Martian movie) to satisfy me!

Actually, xxhansomaxx is making one, and it looks gorgeous
